revised_title: A New Mechanism for Wave Formation in Explosive Welding
tldr: The authors propose a new mechanism for wave formation in explosive welding, where materials behave like low-viscosity liquids during collision. This leads to the formation of a re-entrant jet and a salient jet, which create high pressure at the stagnation point, causing the parent plate to deform and form waves. The new theory explains the observed behavior in experiments and provides a better understanding of the process.
